channel.title: DroidScape Beta Development
channel.description:
[center][size=14pt][b]DroidScape Beta [/b][/size][/center]
I'll start off by saying, this isn't going to be any easy project. We'll be working off an outdated devo-source that I recently spent some time with and brushed up.
The core of the base is finished, effective login, anti-SYI/Null, NPCDialogue, NPCCombat, PVP, drops, stable processes. What we're lacking right now is content to keep even the most adhd players entertained.
We'll be using a 317 client with 474 Interfaces to bring back the nostalgia from playing Runescape Pre-2007
Now some may be asking what is the goal of the project? Obviously no one wants to sign up for another failed Runescape 2006 Remake
Allow me to elaborate, I want to bring back the excitement and surprise at every click feeling that Runescape had before the graphical updates as well as the notorious Anti-RWT updates. This server will be sandbox-style, with a functioning PVP System, and complex economy.
I want this every random tile in this server occupied at one point, people alching, role-playing, starting clans, organizing events, this server will be largely community-based. I also want there to be appeal for stakers, and PVPERS, which is why the duel area is 100% functional and so is PVP.
Without further ado, these pictures hopefully will give people an idea of the direction of this project.
[img]http://i52.tinypic.com/avge40.png[/img] [img]http://i54.tinypic.com/2i1duuq.png[/img] [img]http://i56.tinypic.com/b81c34.png[/img] [img]http://i51.tinypic.com/rapzeq.png[/img]
What I want in a dev team is an open-minded creative lot, with a strong foundation in Java. I have the resources to host a website/forum, as well as a 24/7 VPS because times have changed. And that's the only way to stay competitive.
Honestly this is an RSPS all I need are Java programmers Post an application like such:
Experience in Java: MSN: Extra Info:

item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

theUnforgiven:

Update! We finished our forums and acquired a windows VPS!

I think having a Linux VPS would of been better. Windows VPS’ are not something I would want to call safe. Nevertheless, thanks for the update.
